Context: In this poem, Margarita Engle writes about her experience growing up in Los Angeles, California. She prefers the summers that she spent on the island of Cuba, her mother's homeland.
Title: Escape
Author: by Margarita Engle
Content: on our way to the farm,
where there will be more animals
than people, and I won't have to struggle
As we bump along a muddy track
in Tío¹ Darío's battered jeep, I inhale
Everything looks just as wild and free
It's as if my other self has been here
